posts.author: Apocrypha
posts.content: So, I was planning on running through the Aielund Saga (again), and while I normally focus more on roleplay in a build than powergaming, I thought this combo had potential enough to sufficiently be both. I have most of the levels planned out: 10 in RDD per usual, 9 in Sorcerer for Stoneskin, and the rest in Monk. The plan was for him to buff himself with Stoneskin and other minor spells, then run in and melee with that nicely boosted Strength. I could still use some help organizing the stats and picking out feats, so any help would be appreciated.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I have played through Aielund twice (one with a group) and if you want my honest opinion, it is not worth it to take 9 sorcerer lvls for stoneskin.

As you are familiar with the module i will just point out that the damage reductions on armors and shields will quickly make the spell obsolete.

If you still want to make such a build, we will help you out but first we need to know what do you intent to use. Your fists or a weapon?

posts.author: Apocrypha
posts.content:
Fists. I know kamas have more cheese potential, but there are certain parts in the series where you lose your inventory and being able to fight without weapons would be a lot more useful. And I like the concept of a half-dragon monk beating people up with his bare hands (claws?).

I personally would prefer Stoneskin, but if you have any better ideas for where to stop levels, I'm open to suggestions!

posts.content: I have played the Aielund Saga with that same combo, but with only 1 level of Sorcerer (at level 21) to get RDD. Unfortunately, that build is on my other computer, which is down right now. I have read that Dev Crit is disabled in the current version of the Aielund Saga, so leave it out of the build.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Fists it is then.

And there are some nice pair of gloves in the module as well, so a good choice nevertheless.

This is what Empyre is talking about. -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 93884.html

In place of his Over. Critical & Dev. Critical take two additional GR. STR for a final STR of 40 & AB of 44.

This ain't a sorcerer build as you might want, but from a powerplay perspective it is very strong. You can still use sorcerer scrolls to buff if you like though.

posts.author: Apocrypha
posts.content: That is a really good build, but you're right, it's not what I'm looking for. Appreciate it nonetheless! Is there anything with more than a dip into Sorc?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Aye there are, but they assume (correctly) that the focus is on a weapon rather and focus on that.

The reason behind that, is that you need Monk 16 & RDD 10 both if you want the D20 fists and the full bonusses from RDD, thus leaving little room for more sorcerer. So they abandon the concept and instead focus on rising spellcasting potencial.

Such a build is this one -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 07983.html

Again a good build, focused in the power of a Dev. Crit Sorcerer-spellsword but he used Monk for the added bonusses only and not as the focus of the build that you want.


Frankly for what you want there are two choices.

Either you make a custom build that have the most Sorcerer levels you can fit in (Sorcerer 12/ Monk 18/ RDD 10) for example OR you select and play a true Monk without the RDD class.

Here is mine -> the-iron-fist-monk-35-ftr-5-t2349903.html

And here is a Stunner Monk (scroll down a bit) -> legendary-master-for-consideration-t2350034.html


I hope that helped a bit to help you make up your mind.

posts.content:

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, I think I can help you help yourself

AB is BAB + STR (or DEX if you have Weapon Finesse and a higher DEX than STR) modifier + feats + magical enhancements. BAB is the one that is a bit more complex. Basically, it's class-related for the first 20 levels, then grows constantly at the rate of 1 every 2 levels (starts at odd levels, then goes on.

You should read THIS GUIDE to understand most "general" factors of character building. What I mean by general factors is stuff that applies to all builds, or at least most (AB is irrelevant for a pure caster, for example). A list of the main "general" factors:

1- BAB progression
2- Skill Dumps
3- Feats and Requirements
4- Class-specific bonus feat rewards (Clerics gain a bonus feat every 3 levels after 20, Druids gain a bonus feat every 4 levels after 20, etc...)
5- Spread optimization (Optimization of the number of levels of each class you need to take to maximize the power of your build).
6- Stat considerations
7- Leveling order and feat selection order
8- Skill point allocation per level.

Yeah, you got a lot of work to do. Have fun!!!

Have fun!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Alright, i made a rough build based on your needs and tried to get most things the earliest possible although i am sure it takes some optimization more.

I went in chunks of either 4 OR 8 with the three classes to preserve as much AB was possible while giving you those Sorcerer buffs pre-epic. You no longer have to wait till lvl 36 to cast stoneskin.

I took Craft Wands so you can now spam those spells of yours as much as needed. Extend spell was taken as well to better utilize those damage shields you can cast.

Take Pixie as a familiar so you can unlock doors all by yourself.

Final AB is 40 which is not bad at all actually, especially when you hit like a truck with your 36 STR (48 Buffed). And if that Tenser's of the EMS works as it should it will be much-much higher.

Perhaps Max, that has played the module some times can tell us if that works or not.
